name: types of films, plays, books, etc

children.name: trilogy
children.definition: a series of three plays, books etc that are about the same people or subject: tác phẩm bộ ba
examples: part 2 of a trilogy

children.name: blockbuster
children.definition: a film that a lot of people watch and that makes a lot of money, especially a film with a lot of exciting action: bom tấn
examples: Bruce Willis’s new blockbuster took $10.6 million in its first weekend.
The latest Hollywood blockbuster.
‘Roots’ became a blockbuster TV series.

children.name: classic
children.definition: a classic book, film, design etc is one that is important or special and remains popular for a long time: kinh điển
examples: ▪ The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of our century.
▪ the classic Bogart version of ‘The Maltese Falcon’
▪ ‘Jane Eyre’ is Bronte’s classic novel of courage in the face of despair.
▪ Professor Carey wrote the classic account of early explorations in Africa and Asia.
classicnounHIGH QUALITY tác phẩm kinh điển
[ C ] a piece of writing, a musical recording or a film that is well-known and of a high standard and lasting value
_Jane Austen's 'Pride and Prejudice' is a classicofEnglish literature.
_Many of the Rolling Stones' records have become rock classics.

children.name: slow
children.definition: describes a film, book, play, etc. that does not have much excitement and action: buồn tẻ, nhạt nhẽo
examples: His films are so slow they send me to sleep.

children.name: epic
children.definition: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events: sử thi , anh hùng ca
examples: a Hollywood epic
The film was billed as an epic --an adventure story that would take the world and the box-office by storm.
The history of a single event has been spun out to fill a 255 page epic.
epic[adj]an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events :
an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
epic poetry
the epic poem "Beowulf'
an epic film about the Roman Empire

children.name: farce
children.definition: a humorous play or film where the characters become involved in unlikely situations: tiểu phẩm khôi hài

children.name: comedy
children.definition: a play, film, television programme, etc that is intended to make people laugh:
examples: a highly successful TV comedy

children.name: romantic comedy
children.definition: alsoromcomUK informal
examples: a film about two people who are in love, which is intended to make the people who watch it feel happy :
Four weddings and a Funeral' is a well-known romantic comedy.
Notting Hill’ is a romantic comedy starring Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant.

children.name: a black comedy
children.definition: about serious subjects, especially death
examples: There are several murders in this black comedy set in Florida.

children.name: a musical comedy
children.definition: with music and singing
examples: As far as musical comedies go, this is one of the most successful.

children.name: a sentimental comedy
children.definition: about emotions such as love and sadness
examples: The film is one of those tearful sentimental comedies.

children.name: a situation comedy
children.definition: a regular comedy TV programme about the same characters
examples: She starred in a situation comedy about a family with teenage kids, that ran for ten years.

children.name: a
examples: TV comedyThe actor played the character Baldrick in the TV comedy 'Blackadder'.

children.name: thriller
children.definition: a book, play or film which has an exciting story, often about solving a crime: giật gân, li kỳ
examples: ‘The Birds’ is a classic Hitchcock thriller.

children.name: political/psychological/spy etc thriller
examples: It's described here as a taut, psychological thriller.

children.name: tragedy
children.definition: a serious play or book that ends sadly, especially with the death of the main character: vở bi kịch
examples: ‘Hamlet’ is one of Shakespeare’s best known tragedies.
Shakespeare's tragedies include 'Hamlet', 'King Lear' and 'Othello'.

children.name: mystery
children.definition: a book, film, or play, especially about a crime or a murder, with a surprise ending that explains all the strange events that have happened: huyền bí
examples: I really enjoy murder mysteries.
a mystery writer
murder mystery
an Agatha Christie mystery

children.name: tragicomedy
children.definition: a play or story containing elements of both comedy and tragedy: bi hài kịch
examples: She has crafted a consistently engaging tragicomedy of life in the big city.

children.name: romance
children.definition: /love story a story about two people who are in love with each other: truyện lãng mạn
examples: The book is very exciting, as well as being a wonderful love story.
a well-known writer of popular romances
a historical romance
She loves reading romances.

children.name: romantic
children.definition: a romantic story or film is about people who are in love: lãng mạn
examples: a romantic novel/comedy
a romantic comedy in which Meg Ryan plays a single mother looking for love

children.name: farce
children.definition: the style of writing or acting in this type of play: khôi hài
examples: The play suddenly changes from farce to tragedy.

children.name: whodunnit
children.definition: a book, film etc about a murder case, in which you do not find out who killed the person until the end: trinh thám
examples: If you enjoy a whodunnit, you’ll lap up Janet Laurence’s ‘Hotel Morgue’.

children.name: comedy
children.definition: a type of film, play, or book, etc that is intentionally funny either in its characters or its action: hài kịch
examples: a comic novel

children.name: a comedy series
children.definition: a regular TV programme about the same characters
examples: I used to like the comedy series 'Friends’.

children.name: a comedy show
children.definition: a performance
examples: She has her own comedy show on TV.

children.name: a comedy writer
examples: He is best known as a comedy writer for radio and television.

children.name: a comedy actor/actress
examples: He was voted the top TV comedy actor.

children.name: a comedy star
children.definition: a very famous comedy actor or actress
examples: The main role in the film is played by comedy star Whoopi Goldberg.

children.name: a comedy film
examples: They were the most successful comedy films of all time.

children.name: a comedy routine
children.definition: the jokes that form a comedy show
examples: He always has a brilliant comedy routine.

children.name: a comedy duo
children.definition: two people who perform together regularly
examples: the legendary comedy duo Laurel and Hardy

children.name: the comedy circuit/scene
children.definition: all the people, places etc involved in providing comedy
examples: She became a major star on the international comedy circuit.

children.name: stand-up comedy
children.definition: performances with one person telling jokes alone
examples: He developed a stand-up comedy act.

children.name: slapstick comedy
children.definition: in which the performers do silly things like falling over, getting dirty etc
examples: The tradition of slapstick comedy goes back to the early days of cinema.

children.name: high comedy
children.definition: intelligent and with very funny conversations and situations
examples: The director wanted actors who could play high comedy.

children.name: low comedy
children.definition: about very silly situations etc
examples: He’s a popular actor who excels at low comedy.

children.name: light comedy
children.definition: about subjects that are not very serious
examples: He is clearly talented at light comedy.

children.name: black/dark comedy
children.definition: about subjects that are usually sad or serious, especially death
examples: The plot contains plenty of black comedy.

children.name: alternative comedy
children.definition: that is different from traditional types of comedy
examples: He’s making a name for himself on the alternative comedy scene.

children.name: comic[adj]
examples: B1 amusing you and making you want to laughOPP tragic:

children.name: comic writer/actress/performer etc
children.definition: sb who writes or performs things that make you laugh

children.name: tragedy
children.definition: this type of play or book: bi kịch

children.name: tragic[attri] relating to tragedy in books or plays
examples: OPP comic:

children.name: tragic hero
children.definition: the main person in a tragedy

children.name: an actor specializing in tragedy
examples: In Greek tragedy, the role of the chorus is to express the audience's reactions to what is happening in the play.

children.name: psychological
children.definition: describes a film or book in which there is a lot of attention given to the way people influence each other's behaviour: tâm lý
examples: a psychologicalthriller

children.name: tragicomedy
children.definition: a type of play or story containing elements of both comedy and tragedy: bi hài kịch
examples: His most recent graphic novel is pure tragicomedy.

children.name: science fiction
children.definition: (informalsci-fi/ SF) books, films, or cartoons about an imagined future, especially about space travel or other planets: khoa học viễn tưởng
examples: a science-fiction novel/story
science fiction[adj]
science fiction writer/movie/book etc
the sci-fi writer William Gibson
‘2001’ is probably the most famous sci-fi movie ever made.

children.name: fiction
children.definition: books and stories about imaginary people and eventsOPP non-fiction: hư cấu, giả tưởng
examples: The book is awork offiction and not intended as a historical account.

children.name: romantic/ historical/ crime/detective fiction
examples: Anthony’s first books were historical fiction.
She reads a lot of romantic fiction.

children.name: parody
children.definition: writing, music, art, speech, etc. that copies sb or sth in an amusing way: tác phẩm nhại, nhái
examples: parody of
a brilliant parody of classical dance
He was an eighteenth-century author who wrote parodiesofother people's works.
in a parody of sth
He swung the door wide open in a parody of welcome.
self-parody(= when sb makes fun of their own style).
Her performance contains a strong element ofself-parody
There is a hint ofself-parody in his later paintings.
